comment.text: This protein binds specifically to 23S rRNA; its binding is stimulated by other ribosomal proteins, e.g. L4, L17, and L20. It is important during the early stages of 50S assembly. It makes multiple contacts with different domains of the 23S rRNA in the assembled 50S subunit and ribosome.

The globular domain of the protein is one of the proteins that surrounds the polypeptide exit tunnel on the outside of the subunit, while an extended beta-hairpin is found that penetrates into the center of the 70S ribosome where it lines the wall of the exit tunnel. Removal of most of this hairpin (residues 85-95) does not prevent its incorporation into 70S ribosomes. Two of the hairpin residues (91 and 93) seem to be involved in translation elongation arrest of the SecM protein, as their replacement by larger amino acids alleviates the arrest.
The wild-type allele (erythromycin sensitive) is dominant over the resistant allele, and is also dominant over the temperature-sensitive allele at both low and high temperatures.
Belongs to the universal ribosomal protein uL22 family.

feature.description: In strain: SK1048; decreases translational rate, tRNA binding and subunit association at 44 degrees Celsius; does not alter 23S rRNA or L4 interactions; not erythromycin resistant.

In strain: N281; confers erythromycin resistance; ribosomes bind erythromycin normally and have normal peptidyltransferase activity; 50S subunits assemble normally, even in the presence of drug; the protein is incorporated into ribosomes in vivo; abolishes translation elongation arrest of SecM.
Incorporated into ribosomes in vivo, but is easily removed by a salt wash.
Abolishes translation elongation arrest of SecM.
Abolishes translation elongation arrest of SecM.
